snippet: Rights groups warn that the charges set a worrying precedent and are part of a strategy by Greek authorities to deter migrants from attempting to travel to the country.
lead_paragraph: ATHENS — Greek authorities have charged an Afghan man in the death of his 6-year-old son as the pair tried to reach the country by sea  a move that rights groups say sets a worrying precedent in criminalizing migrants and is part of a strategy to dissuade them from attempting to travel to the country.
abstract: Rights groups warn that the charges set a worrying precedent and are part of a strategy by Greek authorities to deter migrants from attempting to travel to the country.
headline__main: Asylum Seeker Who Lost His Son on Trek to Greece Is Charged in His Death
headline__print_headline: Asylum Seeker Faces Charges in Son’s Death at Sea

snippet: Prosecutors said Elin Ersson had violated the Swedish aviation act by remaining standing on takeoff. But she vowed to continue her campaign.
lead_paragraph: STOCKHOLM — Swedish prosecutors have indicted a woman who in July staged a standoff to prevent the deportation of a rejected asylum seeker to Afghanistan by refusing to take her seat on the flight.
abstract: Prosecutors said Elin Ersson had violated the Swedish aviation act by remaining standing on takeoff. But she vowed to continue her campaign.
headline__main: Sweden Indicts Woman Who Tried to Block Afghan Man’s Deportation on Flight
headline__print_headline: Sweden Indicts Protester of Afghan’s Deportation

snippet: Sexual violence by refugees raises an uncomfortable question: Is it possible to defend both pluralism and women’s rights?
lead_paragraph: Berlin — A brutal murder case has gripped Germany: On June 6 the body of a 14-year-old girl  Susanna Maria Feldmann  was found in Wiesbaden. She had been raped and strangled. Two days later her alleged assailant  Ali Bashar  a 20-year-old asylum seeker from Iraq  was apprehended in Iraqi Kurdistan  where he had fled. He reportedly confessed to the murder.
abstract: Sexual violence by refugees raises an uncomfortable question: Is it possible to defend both pluralism and women’s rights?
headline__main: The German Feminists’ Dilemma

snippet: Amnesty International said European countries had returned about 10 000 Afghan asylum seekers to escalating violence and an acute humanitarian crisis.
lead_paragraph: KABUL  Afghanistan — After the northern Afghan city of Kunduz fell to the Taliban in 2015  Naqibullah  23  set off for Europe. He had worked as a contracted mechanic for the Afghan forces  and he knew the Taliban would come for him. He spent $8 000  and risked getting shot by Iranian border guards and braving turbulent Mediterranean waters to reach Germany.
abstract: Amnesty International said European countries had returned about 10 000 Afghan asylum seekers to escalating violence and an acute humanitarian crisis.
headline__main: Europe Is Called ‘Willfully Blind’ to Risks Afghan Deportees Face

snippet: Massoud Mosavi  7  and his family were deported from Norway. But he speaks Norwegian and English  and remembers nothing of his native country.
lead_paragraph: KABUL  Afghanistan — Massoud Mosavi is a bright and funny little kid  although these days he is in grim humor. He speaks English well enough that he was able to be interviewed without an interpreter even though he is only 7 — and an Afghan for whom English is his second language.
abstract: Massoud Mosavi  7  and his family were deported from Norway. But he speaks Norwegian and English  and remembers nothing of his native country.
headline__main: A Deported Afghan Boy Returns to a Land Nothing Like Home
headline__print_headline: Afghan Boy Returns to a Land Nothing Like Home

snippet: The conditions of refugee detention centers on remote islands are a national disgrace. But can shame force reform?
lead_paragraph: SYDNEY  Australia — In Dante’s view  the unfortunate souls who dwell in purgatory may suffer excruciating pain  but the promise of their final destination is clear: paradise. Those who languish on the remote  tiny islands — Manus and Nauru — that host Australia’s offshore immigration detention centers are not so lucky.
abstract: The conditions of refugee detention centers on remote islands are a national disgrace. But can shame force reform?
headline__main: Australia’s Gulag Archipelago
headline__print_headline: Australia’s Gulag Archipelago

snippet: The Greek riot police forcibly removed protesters from train tracks at a border camp after Macedonia blocked Afghans from seeking political asylum.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — A decision by the Macedonian authorities to block thousands of Afghan asylum seekers from crossing into the country from Greece set off clashes between migrants and the police on Tuesday  highlighting the challenges facing European nations as they seek to check the flow of people to the Continent.
abstract: The Greek riot police forcibly removed protesters from train tracks at a border camp after Macedonia blocked Afghans from seeking political asylum.
headline__main: Policy Shifts on Refugees Lead to Clashes Between Migrants and Police
headline__print_headline: Clashes Erupt in Greece as Macedonia Bars Afghan Asylum Seekers

snippet: Under threat of an honor killing  a young couple cannot get a visa to leave Afghanistan.
lead_paragraph: BAMIAN  Afghanistan — THIS summer a young newlywed couple watched with a mixture of envy and interest as tens of thousands of their neighbors and countrymen made their way to Europe in the hopes of claiming asylum. Living under the threat of an honor killing for eloping against their families’ wishes  the couple  Zakia and Mohammad Ali  had a better case than most Afghans  but after anguishing over whether to go  they decided to remain here in hiding rather than take the risk of fleeing.
abstract: Under threat of an honor killing  a young couple cannot get a visa to leave Afghanistan.
headline__main: In Danger in Afghanistan  Unable to Flee
headline__print_headline: In Danger in Afghanistan  Unable to Flee

snippet: The diplomatic drain comes amid uncertainty over what conditions will be like in the country after the Western military withdrawal  scheduled to be completed in 2014.
lead_paragraph: KABUL  Afghanistan — When it comes to expressing confidence in Afghanistan’s future  many of the country’s diplomats seem to be voting with their feet when their tours of duty end.
abstract: The diplomatic drain comes amid uncertainty over what conditions will be like in the country after the Western military withdrawal  scheduled to be completed in 2014.
headline__main: As Uncertainty Reigns Back Home  Many Afghan Envoys Decline to Return
headline__print_headline: As Uncertainty Reigns Back Home  Many Afghan Envoys Decline to Return

snippet: Prime Minister Kevin Rudd of Australia will visit Indonesia with one thorny issue atop his agenda: turning the flood of asylum seekers back to a trickle.
lead_paragraph: SYDNEY — When Prime Minister Kevin Rudd of Australia arrives in Indonesia on Thursday for annual talks with President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono  one thorny domestic issue seems sure to top his agenda: turning the flood of asylum seekers trying to reach his country’s shores back to a trickle.
abstract: Prime Minister Kevin Rudd of Australia will visit Indonesia with one thorny issue atop his agenda: turning the flood of asylum seekers back to a trickle.
headline__main: Australian Premier Seeks to Slow Tide of Refugees
headline__print_headline: Australian Premier Seeks to Slow Tide of Refugees

snippet: Far-right ultranationalist groups are exploiting old enmities and new fears across Europe  inflaming xenophobia and violence against immigrants and minorities.
lead_paragraph: ONE evening in September 2011  Ali Rahimi  a 27-year-old Afghan asylum seeker  was hanging around with friends outside his building in central Athens when more than a dozen Greeks approached. Several men set upon Mr. Rahimi  one with a knife. Panicked  he fled into his apartment and fought back  managing to push the men out the door. He found blood gushing from just above his heart  one of five stab wounds in his back and chest.
abstract: Far-right ultranationalist groups are exploiting old enmities and new fears across Europe  inflaming xenophobia and violence against immigrants and minorities.
headline__main: Europe’s New Fascists
headline__print_headline: Europe’s New Fascists

snippet: Several European countries had been sending migrants back to their first port of entry  despite warnings from the U.N. and the Council of Europe that Greece’s system was dysfunctional.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — A closely watched human rights court case in Strasbourg has spurred several European nations to halt the forced return of asylum seekers to Greece.
abstract: Several European countries had been sending migrants back to their first port of entry  despite warnings from the U.N. and the Council of Europe that Greece’s system was dysfunctional.
headline__main: Rights Ruling Stops Return of Refugees to Greece
headline__print_headline: Rights Ruling Stops Return of Refugees to Greece

snippet: Prime Minister Julia Gillard announced a plan on Tuesday for tackling the surge in the number of asylum seekers arriving from Indonesia  one of Australia’s most divisive issues.
lead_paragraph: SYDNEY  Australia  Prime Minister Julia Gillard unveiled her strategy for tackling one of the country’s most divisive issues on Tuesday with a sweeping plan to establish a regional center for processing boat people aiming for refuge in Australia.
abstract: Prime Minister Julia Gillard announced a plan on Tuesday for tackling the surge in the number of asylum seekers arriving from Indonesia  one of Australia’s most divisive issues.
headline__main: Australia Leader Proposes Refugee Hub in East Timor
headline__print_headline: Australia Leader Proposes Refugee Hub in East Timor

snippet: The new Christmas Island refugee detention center has come to symbolize what many call one of Australia’s defining fears: the arrival of boat people from Asia .
lead_paragraph: CHRISTMAS ISLAND  Australia  Deep in the jungle on this small island lost in the Indian Ocean  Australia’s new $370 million refugee detention center reaches its full power after its lights come on at dusk. Bracketed by rain forest  steep cliffs and the sea  it rises from the enveloping darkness and becomes visible from the island’s only inhabited corner  about 10 miles away.
abstract: The new Christmas Island refugee detention center has come to symbolize what many call one of Australia’s defining fears: the arrival of boat people from Asia .
headline__main: Australia Puts Its Refugee Problem on a Remote Island  Behind Razor Wire
headline__print_headline: Australia Puts Its Refugee Problem on a Remote Island  Behind Razor Wire

lead_paragraph: CARACAS — Venezuela is considering selling its fleet of U.S.-made F-16 fighter jets to another country  perhaps Iran  in response to an American ban on arms sales to President Hugo Chávez's government  a military official said Tuesday.
abstract: CARACAS — Venezuela is considering selling its fleet of U.S.-made F-16 fighter jets to another country  perhaps Iran  in response to an American ban on arms sales to President Hugo Chávez's government  a military official said Tuesday.
headline__main: Venezuela may sell jets to Iran  official asserts
headline__print_headline: Venezuela may sell jets to Iran  official asserts

snippet: Thirty-nine Afghans seeking asylum begin hunger strike in Bogor (Indonesia); group was trying to get to Australia when they were detained (S)
lead_paragraph: A group of 39 Afghan asylum seekers started a hunger strike in Bogor  a city south of Jakarta  after the United Nations refused to grant them refugee status and relocate them to a third country. Eighteen of the protestors sewed their mouths shut. The group had been intercepted en route to Australia from Indonesia by the Indonesian authorities two years ago. Evelyn Rusli (NYT)
abstract: Thirty-nine Afghans seeking asylum begin hunger strike in Bogor (Indonesia); group was trying to get to Australia when they were detained (S)
headline__main: World Briefing | Asia-Pacific: Indonesia: Afghans Fast For Asylum
headline__print_headline: World Briefing | Asia-Pacific: Indonesia: Afghans Fast For Asylum

snippet: Two Ghanaian boys dressed in clothes for heat of Africa are found dead in undercarriage of Ghana Airways DC-10 airliner that lands in wintry London; deaths underscore pressures and desperation that drive people from poor and troubled lands to seek...
lead_paragraph: Carrying little more than an empty wallet and a broken padlock between them  two Ghanaian boys in clothes for the heat of Africa were found dead in the undercarriage of a Ghana Airways DC-10 airliner that landed in wintry London on Saturday  the police said today.
abstract: Two Ghanaian boys dressed in clothes for heat of Africa are found dead in undercarriage of Ghana Airways DC-10 airliner that lands in wintry London; deaths underscore pressures and desperation that drive people from poor and troubled lands to seek new lives in wealthy Europe; photos (M)
headline__main: Perils of Migration: 2 Ghanaian Boys Die as Flight Stowaways
headline__print_headline: Perils of Migration: 2 Ghanaian Boys Die as Flight Stowaways

snippet: GEORGIA: President Visits Rebel Area; RUSSIA: Member Of Parliament Attacked; DENMARK: Afghans Offered Cash To Go Home;.
lead_paragraph: GEORGIA: PRESIDENT VISITS REBEL AREA President Eduard A. Shevardnadze visited the Pankisi Gorge  a lawless region said to be home to dozens of Islamic militants and rebels fighting for independence in the Russian republic of Chechnya. His visit came as hundreds of Georgian police and interior troops set up checkpoints in the region in an effort to establish order  as Russia has long demanded. He also attended a memorial service for an elderly Georgian killed in an airstrike on Friday that Georgian officials said was carried out by Russia. The troops in Pankisi have yet to arrest any armed fighters  who appear to have fled in advance of the operation.
abstract: GEORGIA: President Visits Rebel Area; RUSSIA: Member Of Parliament Attacked; DENMARK: Afghans Offered Cash To Go Home;.
headline__main: World Briefing: Europe
headline__print_headline: World Briefing: Europe

snippet: UN refugee commissioner Rudd Lubbers expresses concern about Australia's detention centers for asylum seekers; photo (S)
lead_paragraph: After protests by inmates of detention camps in Australia  the head of the United Nations refugee agency urged the government to review its policy on asylum seekers. Ruud Lubbers  the United Nations high commissioner for refugees  said the agency's guidelines ''state that the detention of asylum seekers -- especially children -- is inherently undesirable.'' The agency is also concerned about Australia's effort  including the inducement of cash payments  to send Afghan asylum seekers back home  citing the ''precarious security situation.'' Elizabeth Olson (NYT)
abstract: UN refugee commissioner Rudd Lubbers expresses concern about Australia's detention centers for asylum seekers; photo (S)
headline__main: World Briefing | United Nations: Australia Detentions Worry Refugee Chief
headline__print_headline: World Briefing | United Nations: Australia Detentions Worry Refugee Chief

abstract: Immigrants and their advocates say Australian government's plan to offer Afghan immigrants money to return to their homeland would not be accepted by many of eligible asylum seekers and could be premature; within Australia opposition is building to government's policy of mandatory detention for all unauthorized immigrants (M)

snippet: Hundreds of asylum seekers at Woomera  Australia's largest immigration detention center  say they will suspend 15-day hunger strike while negotiations continue with government over their detention; government says it has made no change in its poli...
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of asylum seekers at Woomera  Australia's largest immigration detention center  said late Wednesday that they would suspend a 15-day hunger strike while negotiations continued with the government over their detention.
abstract: Hundreds of asylum seekers at Woomera  Australia's largest immigration detention center  say they will suspend 15-day hunger strike while negotiations continue with government over their detention; government says it has made no change in its policy of detaining illegal immigrants while their visa applications are processed  sometimes for years; protests and hunger strikes continue at some other immigration detention centers; asylum seekers at Woomera  largely from Middle East  say their chief demand is to be moved out of mandatory detention; government resumes consideration of visas for Afghan immigrants  process that had been suspended after Taliban government fell (M)
headline__main: Asylum Seekers Detained in Australia Suspend Hunger Strike
headline__print_headline: Asylum Seekers Detained in Australia Suspend Hunger Strike

snippet: Nine teenage Afghans seeking asylum are threatening to kill themselves unless they are freed from Australian camp where hundreds of illegal immigrants have been on hunger strike for two weeks to protest their detention; immigrants are protesting c...
lead_paragraph: Nine teenage Afghans seeking asylum are threatening to kill themselves unless they are freed from a camp where hundreds of illegal immigrants have been on a hunger strike for two weeks to protest their detention.
abstract: Nine teenage Afghans seeking asylum are threatening to kill themselves unless they are freed from Australian camp where hundreds of illegal immigrants have been on hunger strike for two weeks to protest their detention; immigrants are protesting conditions at camp and government's policy of detaining all illegal immigrants while their applications for asylum wind through bureaucracy  which can take years; detainees at other centers across Australia have joined protests; some have sewn their mouths shut and others have harmed themselves or attempted suicide; photo (M)

headline__print_headline: Suicide Threat By 9 Refugees Held in Camp By Australia

snippet: Australian government will resume processing visas for Afghan asylum seekers today (S)
lead_paragraph: The government will resume processing visas for Afghan asylum seekers today  Immigration Minister Philip Ruddock said after a meeting with the government's advisory group on alien detention centers. The government stopped processing applications from illegal Afghan immigrants after the Taliban government fell. Hundreds of asylum-seekers are staging a hunger strike inside the largest center  protesting the policy of holding illegal immigrants behind barbed-wire fences during the wait for their cases to be resolved  which can last months or years. On Wednesday  three Afghan immigrants  including a 16-year-old boy  tried to hang themselves  the government said.
abstract: Australian government will resume processing visas for Afghan asylum seekers today (S)
headline__main: World Briefing | Asia: Australia: Policy Change On Afghan Migrants
headline__print_headline: World Briefing | Asia: Australia: Policy Change On Afghan Migrants

lead_paragraph: As many as 40 Afghan asylum seekers  some of whom sewed their lips together last week to protest being held in the arid outback at one of Australia's largest and harshest detention camps  have collapsed from dehydration  according to a statement smuggled out from the detainees and received in Sydney today.

lead_paragraph: Australia's conservative prime minister  John Howard  won a remarkable election victory last Saturday  with a swing to his government of about 2 percent. This is the biggest swing to a sitting government since 1966 and puts him on course to become Australia's second longest serving prime minister  behind his hero Sir Robert Menzies (1949-1966).

snippet: British authorities charge 13 Afghans with hijacking Ariana Afghan Airlines jetliner with more that 150 people aboard during domestic flight and forcing it on odyssey across Middle East and Europe before ending saga at Stansted Airport outside Lon...
lead_paragraph: Thirteen Afghans were charged today with hijacking the airliner that spent last week parked on a remote runway at a British airport with more than 150 people aboard. The men  ranging in age from 18 to 36  could face long prison sentences if convicted.
abstract: British authorities charge 13 Afghans with hijacking Ariana Afghan Airlines jetliner with more that 150 people aboard during domestic flight and forcing it on odyssey across Middle East and Europe before ending saga at Stansted Airport outside London; 13 men  ranging in ages from 18 to 36  could face long prison sentences; British authorities question 14th suspect; say six others arrested in connection with hijacking were not charged and will join group of 73 passengers applying for political asylum (M)

snippet: Hijacking of Afghan airliner ends peacefully at Stansted airport on Feb 10; British officials say 21 people aboard airliner have been arrested in connection with hijacking  and that some of suspects are expected to seek asylum in Britain; say 60 a...
lead_paragraph: No sooner had the government orchestrated a peaceful end to a four-day hijacking of an Afghan airliner at Stansted airport this morning than it was faced with another crisis: how to sort the hijackers from the hostages and deal with all those suddenly clamoring for political asylum in Britain.
abstract: Hijacking of Afghan airliner ends peacefully at Stansted airport on Feb 10; British officials say 21 people aboard airliner have been arrested in connection with hijacking  and that some of suspects are expected to seek asylum in Britain; say 60 adults and 14 children of 150 or so passengers have requested asylum  apparently in effort to flee repressive Taliban regime in Afghanistan; photo (M)

snippet: An asylum seeker was found guilty of manslaughter in the death of a German man last year in the eastern city of Chemnitz that added fuel to an anti-immigrant backlash.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — A German court convicted a Syrian asylum seeker of manslaughter on Thursday over a stabbing last year that touched off nationalist and neo-Nazi rioting in the eastern city of Chemnitz and revealed the strength of an anti-immigrant backlash.
abstract: An asylum seeker was found guilty of manslaughter in the death of a German man last year in the eastern city of Chemnitz that added fuel to an anti-immigrant backlash.
headline__main: Syrian Is Convicted in Stabbing Death That Set Off Riots in Germany
headline__print_headline: Guilty Verdict In a Killing That Fueled German Riots

snippet: Two plays at one of the city’s most important theaters make the case for accepting displaced people  as politics there is turning against them.
lead_paragraph: MUNICH — In the summer of 2015  the world watched in astonishment as Germans cheered crowds of refugees streaming into train stations throughout the country. Scenes from that unprecedented — and short-lived — moment of welcome form part of “What They Want to Hear ” one of two current productions about exile and its ordeals at the Münchner Kammerspiele  one of Munich’s  and Germany’s  most important theaters.
abstract: Two plays at one of the city’s most important theaters make the case for accepting displaced people  as politics there is turning against them.
headline__main: In Conservative Munich  a Theater Turns Radical and Defends Refugees

snippet: Israel is a safeguard for Jews  not a vanity.
lead_paragraph: Adam Armoush is a 21-year-old Israeli Arab who  on a recent outing in Berlin  donned a yarmulke to test a friend’s contention that it was unsafe to do so in Germany. On Tuesday he was assaulted in broad daylight by a Syrian asylum-seeker who whipped him with a belt for being “yahudi” — Arabic for Jew.
abstract: Israel is a safeguard for Jews  not a vanity.
headline__main: Jewish Power at 70 Years
headline__print_headline: Jewish Power At 70 Years

snippet: From “The Three Musketeers” to “Macbeth ” here’s our guide to summer theater that won’t cost you a dime.
lead_paragraph: New York’s most high-profile free summer theater program is Shakespeare in the Park  the Public Theater’s annual series at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park. (It’s the one that recently found itself the target of protests over an onstage death of a Trumplike Julius Caesar.) But there are other local companies devoted to putting on shows — most of them outdoors  weather permitting — that won’t cost you a penny. Here’s a guide.
abstract: From “The Three Musketeers” to “Macbeth ” here’s our guide to summer theater that won’t cost you a dime.
headline__main: Free Shows to See in New York This Summer

snippet: For all its outrage and rancor  Trump’s campaign has  from the beginning  been mostly about grieving.
lead_paragraph: At recent rallies  Donald Trump’s warm-up playlist  the one the candidate famously insists on choosing himself  has featured “Funeral for a Friend/Love Lies Bleeding ” the opening medley from Elton John’s 1973 album “Goodbye Yellow Brick Road.” Like a lot of the playlist  it’s an endearingly perverse song for a political event  opening with a somber minor-key dirge performed on a chorus of analog synthesizers. The track played at least a couple of times at the Giant Center arena in Hershey  Pa.  on Friday night  as we waited for Trump to arrive  and whenever the dolorous synths cut through the fried-dough-scented air  I felt as if I were at some hybrid of a monster-truck rally and a requiem Mass.
abstract: For all its outrage and rancor  Trump’s campaign has  from the beginning  been mostly about grieving.
headline__main: Donald and the Dead

snippet: Some in Hollywood are lobbying for the White Helmets to receive the Nobel Peace Prize.
lead_paragraph: The complex and brutal conflict in Syria has defied the best efforts of peace negotiators and humanitarian officials for more than five years  but a new group of luminaries is weighing in on a war that has cost hundreds of thousands of lives: celebrities.
abstract: Some in Hollywood are lobbying for the White Helmets to receive the Nobel Peace Prize.
headline__main: After Years of War  Celebrities Find a Syrian Group to Back

snippet: The thousands of Muslim asylum seekers pouring into Denmark have spawned a backlash  and questions over whether the country has a latent racial hostility at its core.
lead_paragraph: TAARNBY  Denmark — Johnny Christensen  a stout and silver-whiskered retired bank employee  always thought of himself as sympathetic to people fleeing war and welcoming to immigrants. But after more than 36 000 mostly Muslim asylum seekers poured into Denmark over the past two years  Mr. Christensen  65  said  “I’ve become a racist.”
abstract: The thousands of Muslim asylum seekers pouring into Denmark have spawned a backlash  and questions over whether the country has a latent racial hostility at its core.
headline__main: ‘I’ve Become a Racist’: Migrant Wave Unleashes Danish Tensions Over Identity
headline__print_headline: Muslim Migrants Spawn Backlash in Denmark

snippet: The authorities received a tip that the man  a Syrian  was planning an attack later this month  intensifying fears about Islamic extremism and migrants.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — A German special police unit has detained a Syrian asylum-seeker who they said they suspected of plotting a terrorist attack during the opening of the national soccer league season  German officials said Tuesday.
abstract: The authorities received a tip that the man  a Syrian  was planning an attack later this month  intensifying fears about Islamic extremism and migrants.
headline__main: German Police Detain Asylum-Seeker Suspected of Plotting Terrorist Attack
headline__print_headline: Germans Hold Asylum Seeker in Terror Case

snippet: Wary of Muslim immigrants after attacks in Europe  South Korea lets 670 Syrians stay only on annual visas  limiting their ability to find jobs and barring them from benefits.
lead_paragraph: YANGJU  South Korea — Surrounded by salvaged used-cars parts bound for Syria  Ahmad Khalifa has worked 12 hours a day for three years in one country that does not really want him while longing for another that war has destroyed.
abstract: Wary of Muslim immigrants after attacks in Europe  South Korea lets 670 Syrians stay only on annual visas  limiting their ability to find jobs and barring them from benefits.
headline__main: Syrians Seeking Asylum in South Korea Find Only a Cold Shoulder
headline__print_headline: Syrians Seeking Asylum in South Korea Find Only a Cold Shoulder

snippet: Gathering for their second such session in eight days  the ministers haggled over a proposal to resettle an additional 120 000 people across the European Union.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — After weeks of indecision  the European Union voted on Tuesday to distribute 120 000 asylum seekers among member states  a plan meant to display unity in the face of the largest movement of refugees on the Continent since World War II.
abstract: Gathering for their second such session in eight days  the ministers haggled over a proposal to resettle an additional 120 000 people across the European Union.

snippet: The word once conveyed a basic human right  but now countries disagree on who's worthy of refuge.
lead_paragraph: It’s an ancient promise: When outsiders flee to a new place in desperate need  they will not be turned away. The Hebrew Bible speaks of six cities of refuge where someone who caused a death unwittingly would be protected from being killed in revenge. The Greeks allowed slaves who ran away from abusive masters and even some criminals to seek sanctuary in certain temples; ‘‘asylum’’ comes from their word for inviolable. According to legend  Romulus  the founder of Rome  extended asylum to people we would call migrants  choosing a spot between two groves on Capitoline Hill for his city’s temple of asylum. ‘‘A crowd of commoners  both free and enslaved  poured in from the neighboring territories  eager for new conditions ’’ the historian Livy wrote. ‘‘This was the first step towards the strength Romulus envisioned for Rome.’’
abstract: The word once conveyed a basic human right  but now countries disagree on who's worthy of refuge.
headline__main: Who Qualifies for ‘Asylum’?
headline__print_headline: Stateless

snippet: The Syrian military is committing extraordinary slaughter in civilian neighborhoods.
lead_paragraph: GAZIANTEP  Turkey — As the self-proclaimed Islamic State  or ISIS  commits horrendous videotaped executions  it might seem to pose the greatest threat to Syrian civilians. In fact  that ignoble distinction belongs to the barrel bombs being dropped by the military of Syria’s president  Bashar al-Assad. The Islamic State has distracted us from this deadly reality.
abstract: The Syrian military is committing extraordinary slaughter in civilian neighborhoods.
headline__main: Barrel Bombs  Not ISIS  Are the Greatest Threat to Syrians
headline__print_headline: At Least Stop Assad’s Barrel Bombs

snippet: Norway is skeptical of Sweden’s open door for asylum seekers.
lead_paragraph: THE narrow victory of the left-leaning Social Democratic Party in Sweden’s elections last Sunday marked a broad shift in its politics. But a new coalition government is unlikely to reconsider one of the country’s most challenging policies: its response to the Syrian civil war. Sweden has taken an open-door approach to people fleeing the conflict  accepting more Syrians than any other European country.
abstract: Norway is skeptical of Sweden’s open door for asylum seekers.
headline__main: Scandinavians Split Over Syrian Influx
headline__print_headline: Scandinavians Split Over Syrian Influx

snippet: An Iraqi defector’s testimony was critical in paving the way to war. The problem was  it was all a lie.
lead_paragraph: IN the last months before the American-led invasion of Iraq  as we now know all too well  the administration of President George W. Bush showed a fine disregard for truth or consequences. This manifested itself in many ways  from insinuations about Saddam Hussein’s ephemeral Qaeda connections to the Pentagon’s willful refusal to address the human and economic costs of occupation. Bookstore shelves now groan with wide-ranging accounts struggling to chronicle the pathological hubris that drove the United States onward to Baghdad.
abstract: An Iraqi defector’s testimony was critical in paving the way to war. The problem was  it was all a lie.
headline__main: Artificial Intelligence
headline__print_headline: Artificial Intelligence

snippet: German trial of six Iraqis  seeking political asylum  who invaded Iraqi Embassy in Berlin last August begins; defense claims actions were peaceful protest against Saddam Hussein's regime (S)
lead_paragraph: A trial began for six Iraqi asylum-seekers who stormed the Iraqi Embassy in Berlin last August. They are accused of holding four people hostage  including the Iraqi chargé d'affaires  before a police raid ended the five-hour siege. Defense lawyers say the action was a peaceful protest against the government of Saddam Hussein. A verdict is expected in May. Victor Homola (NYT)
abstract: German trial of six Iraqis  seeking political asylum  who invaded Iraqi Embassy in Berlin last August begins; defense claims actions were peaceful protest against Saddam Hussein's regime (S)

lead_paragraph: ITALY: ANTHRAX SCARE SHUTS U.S. EMBASSY OFFICE The American embassy in Rome closed its consular visa office after an an anthrax scare  an embassy official said. Employees discovered an envelope containing a white powder in the office on Monday  and Italian officials immediately sealed off the unit. Samples of the powder tested negative for anthrax  and the embassy expects to reopen the visa office today.
